alert.note: Alert for Atkinson (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued June 14 at 6:29PM EDT until June 14 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT FOR WESTERN ATKINSON COUNTY... At 627 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Willacoochee, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Willacoochee around 640 PM EDT. Pearson around 700 PM EDT. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! This is a potentially dangerous situation especially near Willacoochee! If possible move to a basement or find an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
